SEARCH
Package babbynannyapi.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
babbynannyapi.controller.Controller
@RestController @RequestMapping("/BabyNanny") public class Controller extends Object
Controller responsible for handling all Baby-related API requests. This class manages creation, updates, deletion, and retrieval of Baby entities, including associated records such as medical, sleep, and intake records.

  • Method Details

    • createParsedBaby

      public Map<String,Object> createParsedBaby(Baby b)
      Builds a structured representation of a Baby entity ready to be serialized and returned in an API response.
      Parameters:
      b - the Baby entity to be parsed and transformed
      Returns:
      a Map containing the serialized representation of the Baby and its related data

    • deleteBaby

      @DeleteMapping("/deleteBaby/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteBaby(@PathVariable String id, @RequestHeader String token)
      Deletes a Baby entity identified by its ID. The request must include a valid authentication token in the header. If the token exists, the method retrieves the Baby, removes its association with the user, and deletes it from the database. If the token is not valid, the request is rejected with 401 Unauthorized.
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier of the Baby to delete
      token - authentication token provided in the request header
      Returns:
      204 No Content if deletion succeeds, or 401 Unauthorized if the token is invalid

    • deleteBabyFromUser

      @PutMapping public void deleteBabyFromUser(Baby baby)
      Removes the given Baby from all users listed as its tutors. For each tutor username stored in the Baby entity, the method looks up the corresponding User. If the user exists and contains the Baby's ID in their babies list, the ID is removed and the updated User entity is saved.
      Parameters:
      baby - the Baby entity whose references must be removed

    • changeImage

      @PutMapping("/changeImage/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> changeImage(@PathVariable String id, @RequestHeader String token, @RequestBody Map<String,Object> image)
      Updates the image of a Baby identified by its ID. The request must include a valid authentication token in the header. If the token exists, the method retrieves the Baby entity, updates its image field with the value received in the request body, and saves the changes. If the token is invalid, the request is rejected with 401 Unauthorized.
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier of the Baby whose image will be updated
      token - authentication token provided in the request header
      image - request body containing the new image value
      Returns:
      204 No Content if the update succeeds, or 401 Unauthorized if the token is invalid

    • changeImage

      @PutMapping("/createEvent/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> changeImage(@PathVariable String id, @RequestHeader String token, @RequestBody Event events)
      Creates or updates the event information of a Baby identified by its ID. The request requires a valid authentication token in the header. If the token exists, the method retrieves the Baby entity, sets its event data using the Event object received in the request body, and saves the updated entity. If the token is invalid, the request is rejected with 401 Unauthorized.
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier of the Baby whose event data will be updated
      token - authentication token provided in the request header
      events - Event object received in the request body
      Returns:
      204 No Content if the operation succeeds, or 401 Unauthorized if the token is invalid

    • changeConfig

      @PutMapping("/changeConfig/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> changeConfig(@PathVariable String id, @RequestHeader String token, @RequestBody Map<String,Object> config)
      Updates the configuration settings of a User identified by its ID. The request must include a valid authentication token in the header. If the token exists, the method retrieves the User entity, replaces its configuration with the data received in the request body, and saves the updated entity. If the token is invalid, the request is rejected with 401 Unauthorized.
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier of the User whose configuration will be updated
      token - authentication token provided in the request header
      config - map containing the new configuration values
      Returns:
      204 No Content if the update succeeds, or 401 Unauthorized if the token is invalid

    • updateFeatures

      @PutMapping("/updateFeatures/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> updateFeatures(@PathVariable String id, @RequestHeader String token, @RequestBody Features features)
      Updates the features of a Baby and records the previous features. The request requires a valid authentication token in the header. If the token exists, the method retrieves the Baby entity, creates a new FeaturesRecord to store the current features, adds it to the Baby's feature history, updates the Baby's features with the new data from the request body, and saves the Baby entity. If the token is invalid, the request is rejected with 401 Unauthorized.
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier of the Baby whose features will be updated
      token - authentication token provided in the request header
      features - new features data received in the request body
      Returns:
      204 No Content if the update succeeds, or 401 Unauthorized if the token is invalid

    • logOut

      @DeleteMapping("/logOut/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> logOut(@PathVariable String id)
      Logs out a user by deleting their authentication token. The method receives the token ID as a path variable. If the token exists, it is removed from the repository, effectively logging the user out. If the token does not exist, the request is rejected with 401 Unauthorized.
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier of the token to delete
      Returns:
      204 No Content if the token is deleted successfully, or 401 Unauthorized if the token is not found

    • login

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> login(@RequestBody User user)
      Creates a new token in the database with the information provided in the request body.
      Parameters:
      user - The user object containing the registration details.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with HTTP 200 OK if the baby is created successfully, or HTTP 401 Unauthorized if the user don't have a correct token.

    • newBaby

      @PostMapping("/newBaby") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> newBaby(@RequestBody Baby baby, @RequestHeader String token)
      Creates a new baby in the database with the information provided in the request body.
      Parameters:
      baby - The baby object containing the baby information.
      token - A identification for the user.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with HTTP 200 OK if the baby is created successfully, or HTTP 401 Unauthorized if the user don't have a correct token.

    • verifyCode

      @PostMapping("/verify") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> verifyCode(@RequestBody User user, @RequestHeader String code)
      Verifies a registration or confirmation code for a new user. The request body must include a User object, and the code is passed in the request header.
      Parameters:
      user - the User object from the request body containing registration details
      code - the verification code sent in the request header
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with 200 OK and Token if successful, or 401 Unauthorized if verification fails

    • createCode

      public String createCode()
      Generates a random 6-digit numeric code as a String.
      Returns:
      a 6-digit random code as a String
